DOC.brief_summary: This randomize pilot study evaluate feasibility acceptability phone-based wellness program improve mood , physical activity , smoke abstinence rate among people depression also physically inactive smoke cigarette .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness The Step Up Wellness Program People With Depression
DOC.detailed_description: This pilot study evaluate feasibility , acceptability , potential effectiveness Step Up Wellness Program among people depression also physically inactive smoke cigarette . Participation study last 6 month . All participant complete baseline survey assign randomly receive Step Up Wellness Program usual care 3 month . Participants Step Up program receive weekly phone call study health coach . During call , coach discus way improve manage mood , increase physical activity , prepare quit smoking . Participants also give material review homework assignment call . Participants usual care group receive standard care include referral treatment depression nicotine dependence , well self-help information physical activity . All participant survey 4 6 month post-enrollment . Participants also provide qualitative feedback program .
DOC.criteria: Member Group Health insurance plan Aged 18 75 Experiencing least moderate depressive symptom Low physical activity define failure meet Centers Disease Control ( CDC ) guideline weekly activity OR low moderate physical activity assess International Physical Activity Questionnaire ( IPAQ ) Current smoker Has phone Able read speak English No mobility physical impairment would prevent engage moderate physical activity Without hear impairment would prevent participation phonebased counsel assessment Selfreport bipolar disorder schizophrenia Currently receive specialty mental health care smoke cessation treatment If antidepressant , take less 30 day
